strategy.title: Strategy
strategy.description: Free State AG is an established producer of green electricity in Switzerland and operates modern solar power plants. In the medium term, the company aims to build a diverse and balanced portfolio of renewable energies with a total installed capacity of 59 megawatts*. The goal is to position itself as one of the leading operators of renewable energies in Switzerland.
strategy.diversification: A central element of the investment strategy is diversification. It minimizes risks in the areas of market conditions, legal frameworks and availability of generation types.
strategy.future: In the future, electricity production from solar energy should account for about 20‚Äì30 percent of the company's revenue. Free State AG invests exclusively in plants with mature technology that are either already in operation or have full approval at the start of construction. The sale of power plants is not part of the business model.
strategy.synergies: In addition to further acquisitions, Free State maximizes synergies in plant operation to continuously increase operational efficiency. The expansion of a diversified portfolio should sustainably promote revenue and profit development.

investorsPage.title: For Investors
investorsPage.subtitle: Your energy, our responsibility ‚Äì sustainable and worry-free

investing.title: Invest sustainably
investing.description: With an investment in renewable energies, you are betting on sustainable and future-proof value creation. Free State AG offers you the opportunity to participate in solar power plants and other environmentally friendly projects. Benefit from stable returns, a growing market and an active contribution to the energy transition. Our experience and our focus on mature technologies guarantee you security and success ‚Äì for a greener future.

form.title: Order documents free of charge
form.description: Do you want to make a positive contribution to the environment and society? Request our documents free of charge now and find out how you can actively contribute to the energy transition with sustainable energy solutions and investments in renewable energies. Simply fill out the form, and we will send you the requested documents directly. Use this opportunity to inform yourself comprehensively and shape a green and successful future together with us!
form.privacy: I hereby confirm that I have read the privacy policy.

invest.question: Can I invest in Free State Energie AG?
invest.answer: If you are a person with residence in Switzerland and qualify as a qualified investor by investing funds or knowledge, then yes. Every person with residence in Switzerland who has a Swiss bank account and experience in the investment world can subscribe to shares under the officially set conditions of the capital increase.

deposit.question: Where are my Free State AG shares deposited?
deposit.answer: The shares of Free State Energie AG are digitized and are issued by Schaffhauser Kantonalbank AG and distributed to a deposit account at your bank. It is possible that your bank values them at a price of 0 (zero), as the company is not yet listed on the stock exchange.

listed.question: Is Free State Energie AG listed on a public stock exchange?
listed.answer: No, currently the company is privately owned and is not listed on a stock exchange. Each shareholder has full shareholder rights including dividend rights. Free State AG intends to go public in the near future, but this depends heavily on the market situation, company development and the number of investors.

instructions.main: Click on the map to outline the area where you want to install solar panels.
list: Draw the outline of your roof as seen from above
Click to add points, edge distances are shown automatically
Click near the first point to auto-complete the polygon
After completing, you can drag points to adjust

step2.autoComplete: ‚úì Click near the first point to auto-complete
step2.selfIntersecting: ‚ö†Ô∏è Polygon lines are crossing. Please redraw without overlapping edges for accurate area calculation.
step2.info: üí° This is the horizontal projection area. Actual roof surface will be calculated based on roof pitch in later steps.

step3.title: Panel Orientation
step3.subtitle: Configure your solar panel angle and direction for accurate production estimates

roofType.title: Roof Type & Panel Tilt
roofType.flatDescription: Panel tilt on mounting racks (roof is flat)
roofType.slopedDescription: Panel tilt matches roof pitch (flush mounting)

panelDirection.title: Panel Direction
panelDirection.flatDescription: Flat roofs: panels mounted on tilted frames
panelDirection.slopedDescription: Sloped roofs: panels face same direction as roof
panelDirection.customInfo: Use presets above or enter precise direction (0¬∞=North, 90¬∞=East, 180¬∞=South, 270¬∞=West)

flatRoofAlert.title: Flat Roof Installation:
flatRoofAlert.description: Panels will be mounted on tilted frames (typically 10-20¬∞) to optimize production and allow water runoff. You have full freedom to choose panel direction - South (180¬∞) is optimal for maximum annual production in Switzerland.

optimizationTips.title: Optimization Tips
tips: South-facing panels (180¬∞) receive the most sunlight in Switzerland
A tilt of 30-35¬∞ is optimal for maximizing yearly production
East/West orientations can be beneficial if you consume more electricity in morning/evening
For flat roofs, panels can face any direction using tilted mounting racks

step4.dcAcRatio: DC/AC ratio: 1.2-1.5:1 is optimal. Industry standard is 1.1-1.5:1 for residential systems. Multiple inverters are common for larger systems.

electricityPrices.title: üí° Your Electricity Prices
electricityPrices.description: Enter your actual rates from your electricity bill for accurate savings calculations. These greatly affect your payback period.
electricityPrices.whereToFindText: Check your latest electricity bill. The electricity price is what you pay per kWh consumed. The feed-in tariff is what you earn for excess energy exported to the grid.

step2Usable.noSegments: No roof segments selected. Please go back and select at least one roof segment.

step2Usable.nonSelectedSegmentsInfo: There are {count} other roof segment(s) on this building (shown in gray). Restricted areas drawn over these segments won't affect your usable area calculation.

hero.title:
How a solar
power system works

section.title: How it works
section.subtitle: How does a solar power system work?
section.description:
A solar power system converts the radiant energy of sunlight into usable electricity. The solar modules on the roof capture the sun's rays with the help of solar cells and thus produce direct current (DC). This DC is then converted into alternating current (AC), i.e., electrical current, by an inverter.

Solar power is therefore electricity generated by the photovoltaic effect in solar cells. No exhaust emissions are produced during electricity generation.
section.imageCaption: The following graphic shows how a solar system works, including the positioning of the most important elements in the house:
section.imageAlt: Diagram showing how a solar power system works in a house

solarPanel.title: How a solar panel works
solarPanel.description: Solar panels can convert sunlight into electricity. This is made possible by semiconductors (silicon), which conduct electricity. As soon as sunlight shines on the solar panel, electrons are excited. The electrons then move through the layers of the solar panel to the inverter. The electrons transport the electricity to where the energy is needed. Depending on demand, the energy goes directly to the end users (light bulb, PC, battery, etc.), where the electricity is available for later use.
solarPanel.infoCard: Solar modules ‚Äì also called solar panels ‚Äì consist of many small solar cells. When many solar modules are connected together, it is called a solar power system.

solarPanels.title: Solar Panels
solarPanels.description: You bear no financial risk ‚Äì we cover all costs for the planning, installation, and maintenance of your solar system.

inverter.title: Inverter
inverter.description: You bear no financial risk ‚Äì we cover all costs for the planning, installation, and maintenance of your solar system.

electricityMeter.title: Electricity Meter
electricityMeter.description: You bear no financial risk ‚Äì we cover all costs for the planning, installation, and maintenance of your solar system.

cta.heading: Get a free, no-obligation quote now!

whichSystem.title: Which solar system is right for me?
whichSystem.description: When choosing the right solar system, you should consider not only your energy consumption but also the size and current characteristics of your roof. You can also choose between a roof-mounted or roof-integrated system, as well as various solar panel colors.

householdConsumption.title: Household consumption
householdConsumption.description: First, you need to determine your household's annual electricity consumption. The solar system should at least cover the household's electricity consumption.

roofArea.title: Size of the roof area
roofArea.description: The roof area determines how many solar panels, and therefore the maximum power output, can be installed. The panels must be arranged in such a way that they cover your household's electricity consumption.

requiredOutput.title: Required photovoltaic system output per household
requiredOutput.description: The electrical output of a photovoltaic system is measured in kWp (kilowatt peak). In Switzerland, depending on location and efficiency, an average of 800-1,300 kilowatt-hours (kWh) can be generated per kWp per year. The following table shows the average required output for different household sizes and the resulting size of the solar system.

headers.size: Size of the solar power system

privacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.subtitle: How we handle your personal data
privacyPolicy.intro: The operators of these pages take the protection of your personal data very seriously. We treat your personal data confidentially and in accordance with the statutory data protection regulations and this privacy policy.

dataCollection.title: Data Collection on Our Website
dataCollection.content:
The data processing on this website is carried out by the website operator. Their contact details can be found in the legal notice of this website.

Your data is collected either when you provide it to us (e.g., data entered in a contact form), or automatically by our IT systems when you visit the website. This is primarily technical data (e.g., internet browser, operating system, or time of page access). This data is collected automatically as soon as you enter our website.

automaticData.title: Automatically Collected Data
automaticData.content:
When you visit our website, our web servers temporarily store each access in a log file. The following data is recorded and stored until automatic deletion:

‚Ä¢ IP address of the requesting computer
‚Ä¢ Date and time of access
‚Ä¢ Name and URL of the retrieved file
‚Ä¢ Website from which access was made (referrer URL)
‚Ä¢ Browser used and, if applicable, the operating system of your computer
‚Ä¢ Name of your access provider

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.content:
Our website uses cookies. Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device. They do not cause any damage.

We use cookies to make our website user-friendly. Some cookies remain stored on your device until you delete them. They enable us to recognize your browser on your next visit.

If you do not want this, you can set up your browser so that it informs you about the setting of cookies and you only allow this in individual cases.

analytics.title: Web Analytics (Matomo)
analytics.content:
This website uses Matomo for web analytics. Matomo uses cookies that are stored on your computer and enable an analysis of the use of the website. The information generated by the cookie about your use of this website is stored on our server in Switzerland.

The IP address is anonymized immediately after processing and before storage. You can prevent the storage of cookies by setting your browser software accordingly. We would like to point out, however, that in this case you may not be able to use all functions of this website to their full extent.

socialMedia.title: Social Media Plugins
socialMedia.content:
Our pages contain plugins from social networks (e.g., Twitter, Instagram). You can recognize these plugins by the respective logos. When you activate these plugins, a direct connection is established between your browser and the server of the respective social network.

We would like to point out that as the provider of the pages, we have no knowledge of the content of the transmitted data or its use by the social networks. For more information, please refer to the privacy policies of the respective networks.

googleMaps.title: Google Maps
googleMaps.content:
This website uses the Google Maps service. The provider is Google Ireland Limited. When you use Google Maps, information about your use of this website (including your IP address) is transmitted to a Google server and stored there.

For more information on the handling of user data, please refer to Google's privacy policy: https://policies.google.com/privacy

newsletter.title: Newsletter
newsletter.content:
If you would like to receive the newsletter offered on the website, we require an email address from you as well as information that allows us to verify that you are the owner of the email address provided.

The data entered in the newsletter registration form is processed exclusively on the basis of your consent (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR). You can revoke your consent at any time. The legality of the data processing operations already carried out remains unaffected by the revocation.

userRights.title: Your Rights
userRights.content:
You have the right to receive information about the origin, recipients, and purpose of your stored personal data free of charge at any time. You also have the right to request the correction or deletion of this data.

If you have given your consent to data processing, you can revoke this consent at any time for the future. You also have the right to request the restriction of the processing of your personal data under certain circumstances.

You also have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority.

dataRetention.title: Data Retention
dataRetention.content: The data collected by us will be deleted after the contractual relationship has ended and the statutory retention periods have expired. If the data is required for the fulfillment of a contract or for the implementation of pre-contractual measures, early deletion of the data is only possible if contractual or legal obligations do not prevent deletion.

contact.title: Contact
contact.content:
If you have any questions about data protection, please contact us at:

Free State AG
Stettemerstrasse 40
8207 Schaffhausen
Switzerland

Phone: +41 52 525 33 05
